item.title: Matt Blaze
item.description: That the new administration is opposed to "DEI" (and is quick to use it as a scapegoat for just about everything bad) is unsurprising and was expected, but the aggressiveness of today's anti-DEI purge is still jarring and disturbing. They are creating an atmosphere in which any attempt to hire, promote, or engage with anyone other than a white male will be regarded as inherently suspect.The damage - to both individuals and to our institutions - will likely be both swift and long lasting.

item.title: Nonya Bidniss :CIAverified:
item.description: As a hiring manager in the Federal government I never hired anyone who was not the most qualified for the job. I was never, ever told by HR that I had to hire based on skin color, ethnicity, or gender, or any other thing besides my assessment of their qualifications based on their resume and interview. The premises of the right wing's #DEI arguments are 100% false. There is some cronyism in govt, I've seen it and it pisses most people off. I'm not claiming it doesn't happen. But in MOST cases, people who are hired were the best for the job. And the white guys simply don't like it when it wasn't them. They don't like it when they didn't have a pal who could secretly direct hire them into a job, the way they've been trained to expect. The executive order to put DEI program personnel on paid leave with a plan to fire them in the near future primarily does one thing: it pushes out of the government a group of employees who happen to be largely POC and women. #fascism #USPol
